import React from "react"; import "./Article.css"; const Article = () => { return (

The Life-Saving Impact of Donating Blood

Every two seconds, someone in the world needs blood. Whether it's a patient undergoing surgery, a victim of a car accident, or someone living with a chronic illness like sickle cell anemia, donated blood often stands between life and death. But despite the constant need, many blood banks face shortages ‚Äî and that‚Äôs where everyday heroes like you come in.

Why Blood Donation Matters

Blood cannot be manufactured; it can only come from generous donors. A single donation can save up to three lives, thanks to how blood is separated into red cells, platelets, and plasma ‚Äî each used for different treatments.

Tips for First-Time Donors

üíß Stay Hydrated: Drink plenty of water before your appointment.
üçΩÔ∏è Eat a Healthy Meal: A balanced meal can help maintain your blood sugar levels.
üö´ Avoid Alcohol: Stay away from alcohol for at least 24 hours before donating.
üëï Wear Comfortable Clothing: Opt for short sleeves or loose-fitting clothing to make the process easier.
); }; export default Article;
